author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Kilakarai police have arrested a flower vendor on the charge of raping a 19-year-old Dalit girl, studying class XII.

Police said R Suresh (24), a flower vendor, who was in love with the girl studying Plus Two in a local government higher secondary school, took her to his house on Thursday night and raped her after promising to marry her.

However, villagers caught him when he brought the girl to drop her in her house at Pullandai in the early hours of Friday. He tried to ditch the victim and escape, police said.

K Maheswari, Deputy Superintendent of Police, investigating officer in the case, said interrogation revealed that the accused, who belonged to Agamudayar community, was in love with the girl for two years and had given her a false promise of marrying her. The DSP tried to convince the man to marry but he refused saying ‘he cannot marry a Dalit,’ Ms. Maheswari said. Acting on a complaint from the victim, police arrested Suresh on Saturday. She was sent to the Government hospital for medical examination, police said.

The accused was arrested under Sections 417 (cheating) and 376 (raping) of Indian Penal Code, read with Section 3 (1) (XII) of Scheduled Castes/Scheduled Tribes (Prevention of Atrocities) Act, 1989 and remanded in judicial custody, police added.
title: Flower vendor held for rape of Dalit girl
